intro: Psychotria christii, commonly known as the "Cuban psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Psychotria christii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a notable species in tropical botany due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
